Posts.Content: Hi Looking at your scores we are very much the same, except I am 64. I had a PSA of 893 in July 2016, Gleason 9, told it was in my shoulder and maybe my hip/pelvis. What I did was sign up for a trial, the one I am on is called Stampede, it involves hormone three monthly injections of prostap3, six sessions over three weeks of docetaxel, finally twenty sessions of radiotherapy. I ve just finished the chemo, and have the radiotherapy next month. My PSA dropped from 893 to 0.08 when last tested, I did change my life style no alcohol, any sweets as cancer loves sugar, red meat maybe a couple of times a month. I take supplements one in general called Pomi-t ( look it up on the net ) not saying this is wonderful but i believe it's helped me.i drink Pomigranite juice and eat lots of fruit all this can help along with some excercise. Hope any of this helps, best of luck.
Posts.Title: Proof that combo Chemo and Hormone Therapy works to lower PSA

Posts.Content: Hi Looking at your scores we are very much the same, except I am 64. I had a PSA of 893 in July 2016, Gleason 9, told it was in my shoulder and maybe my hip/pelvis. What I did was sign up for a trial, the one I am on is called Stampede, it involves hormone three monthly injections of prostap3, six sessions over three weeks of docetaxel, finally twenty sessions of radiotherapy. I ve just finished the chemo, and have the radiotherapy next month. My PSA dropped from 893 to 0.08 when last tested, I did change my life style no alcohol, any sweets as cancer loves sugar, red meat maybe a couple of times a month. I take supplements one in general called Pomi-t ( look it up on the net ) not saying this is wonderful but i believe it's helped me.i drink Pomigranite juice and eat lots of fruit all this can help along with some excercise. Hope any of this helps, best of luck.
Posts.Title: Proof that combo Chemo and Hormone Therapy works to lower PSA

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I am half way through my forth chemo session, my last one was a bit hair raising as my Tempreture went up to 38.3 after a hospital visit they told me I had neptrippena very low white cell count after three days and lots of tests and medication I was released. My chemo has been reduced by 20% as a result of the hospital visit, since then I ve had my forth chemo but my Tempreture is always around 36.1 or 36.2 it does get higher through the day but only to about 36.6/7 does anyone else have this problem ? I feel fine and maybe because of the reduced chemo I am more active except for the stomach pains and shoulder pains so if anyone knows please let me know. Thanks
Posts.Title: Tempreture

Posts.Content: Yep I have advanced prostate Gleason 4+5 5+5 and in June a PSA reading of 893 which has now dropped to 0.16 but my Tempreture fluctuates a lot
Posts.Title: Tempreture

Posts.Content: Hi Seems every time I am having my blood tested I have a low white blood cell count does anyone know what can boost this or have you any ideas to help me. I am on my fifth of six chemo's.
Posts.Title: Low white blood cells

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I live in Manchester England. Some on here know me, but a quick ruin down. Diagnosed in July 2016 Gleason 9 stage T4 PSA 893. I was offered because of my condition a choice of two trials, After a lot of research I choose Stampede, fortunately I was not on the watching group. I had lots of tests blood, scans, x-Ray etc, I had metastistic in my bones, shoulder, ribs, pelvis. At the start I was given hormone tablets followed by a monthly injection, I had a bout of breathing problems which at one point I thought this is it, taken to A and E given lots of tests and scans, I was given a blood thinning injection which helped, a couple of days later breathing better, I put it down to stress and hormone injection. Struggling with my shoulder I had a cortisone injection helped a bit, but I managed to get radiotherapy just one session, that helped a lot, although later it burnt under my arm but steroid cream helped heal it, still have a problem with it but tolerable. I trawled the net checking on anything that would help me, I changed my eating habits stopped drinking only drank pomegranate, orange juice and water, then I read about how different supplements could help, the main being pomi-t which can take up to six months to work into your system then there is omega 3, garlic, b12, turmeric, green tea, pomegranate and grape seed extract, all of which are good for the prostate, how much they work is another thing. My PSA started to tumble going down in a couple of months to single digits, by this time I was put on Prostap 3, three monthly injections, my next attack on this desease was with chemotherapy docetaxel, six sessions every three weeks, the first was an eye opener, two days nothing I thought what was all the fuss about, then wham every bone in my body for 8/10 hours felt like it was on fire, it knocked the stuffing out of me fatigue, tired, wow. All this time lots of loo trips and mega hot flushes, sleep was a thing of the past. Every chemo session I had my blood checked my PSA still kept falling, then on the third session my Tempreture went up to 38.2 you are told to take your Tempreture twice daily and I kept a record of mine,went to hospital, again the tests seems I had neptrippena and a small virus, I stayed there for three days, given drips tablets, and monitored and tested regularly, bit frightening but I was in good hands. After that I had a discussion with my consultant who dropped my dosage by twenty per cent to avoid another episode, I got used to the chemo, although developed tingly fingers and feet and scratchy eyes lost a lot of hair, minor problem, weak and had chemo brain, short term memory loss, which has got better now. I finished the chemotherapy in January. My PSA had dropped to 0.08, I had a little time to recover then beginning of March I started my radiotherapy, twenty sessions over four weeks, I finished the last one yesterday March 31st, in that time I have had at the moment two bad days, we're getting to the toilet was imperative about fifty or more times on both occasions. While all this was going on I had my heart checked as I suffered a lot of chest pain, seems I had acid reflux and was told to avoid certain drinks, I got some Meds for that and also for the hot flushes which both have helped. At the moment I still suffer with my shoulder the most rib pain not bad, back more like a bad back which I hope to have some sort of treatment on radiotherapy or whatever else can be done,eyes better, hands slowly getting better although I get tingly fingers ( pins and needles as we say here ) feet still feel like some one has sown a leather strap on them, not as strong as I used to be, still have the odd bout of breathing problems which I seem strangely concerned about as I used to breath through both nostrils but now which ever way I lie say on the left I breath through the right nostril and vice versa, had everything checked all ok. Hope to start excersise in a few weeks when the effects have worn off from the radiotherapy, do a bit of walking but get tired quickly if I over do it. Had my bloods taken this week, as I suffer from gout and borderline diabeties plus check my liver etc, all good even my PSA is down to 0.07 not much but surprises me as after radiotherapy it can spike. As quality of life goes the last nine months have not been the best, I am hoping that in the future, ( as I plan to be about to get my hard earned pension next month ) I will be more mobile and get a holiday, as my loving wife who constantly worries about me just going shopping, let alone any household chores,deserves a break. This was not everything side effects on chemo I was not lucky with, radiotherapy was better. If this helps anyone of what to expect great.
Posts.Title: A prostate journey using the trial Stampede

Posts.Content: Hi Been reading about this treatment seems only have been going barely two years, wonder if anyone here has heard of it or is being treated with it. If so what are the side effects and is it any good. Joe
Posts.Title: Anyone heard of TOPARP

Posts.Content: Hi all I have a fairly low PSA of 0.04 when last tested a month ago, i have metistic PC Gleason 9/10 depends who's seeing me. My question being can a further or secondary cancer develop with such a low PSA I ve had all the chemo, radiotherapy and on HT forever more, but I ve developed something in my throat, went to ENT they put the camera through the nose touch and a small blood clot was seen, plus fluid or phlegm is not clearing as it should so could I am on gaviiscon advance. Could a secondary cancer possible form. Any help would be great
Posts.Title: Prostate cancer low PSA

Posts.Content: Hi About me, diagnosed in July 2016 PSA 893 Gleason 9 selected for the Stampede trial, first hormone tablets then onto Prostap 3 injections PSA dropped to around 1.27 after eight weeks, had various scans, the cancer was metastistic in my shoulder and ribs, I had radiotherapy one session on my shoulder. Six sessions of docetaxel, followed by twenty sessions of radiotherapy, with three monthly hormone injections of Prostap. It seems the hormone injection has weakened my back they did an X-ray to make sure no involvement with PC. I had pains every so often from the shoulder to the neck and have had a scan of that area with no sign of cancer, the next step there is to have an endoscopy. My PSA is done every three months by the hospital plus I also get the doctors to check it every six months as I have gout and borderline diabeties, they all show the PSA down before this one it was 0.07, now it's 0.04, I suffer from a few side effects still my back, hot flushes, acid reflux, the odd headache, like rhumitism in my hands, and feet still like they've got a leather skin sown on them, lots of toilet visits, tiredness and muscle fatigue. But Iam still fighting this dammed thing and will do as long as I can. Joe
Posts.Title: Prostate cancer low PSA

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I am thinking of having Acupunture, to try and relieve some the aches and pains I have, just wondered has anyone tried this and what was the outcome and do you still use it. I live in Salford not far from Manchester centre if anyone has tried any treatments near here just let me lnow please.
Posts.Title: Acupunture

Posts.Content: Hi everyone There has been a lot of talk about this drug Arbirateron, that is used in conjunction with a hormone drug for people who no longer respond to hormone therapy. It has been used-with people who are on the Stampede trial and the results are very positive, I do not know if this is yet trialed in America as I live in England, but for us advanced PC with metastistic it could be one of the most important finds. With any luck this could well be refined and help all of us who suffer, let alone the people in the later stages of the Joe
Posts.Title: Arbirateron

Posts.Content: Hi I suffer badly with hot flushes and I use cold packs on my head which really helps, trouble is at bed time these are not much use but ok while your just sat at home.
Posts.Title: Hot flash treatments

Posts.Content: Hello I am new to this forum, I have advanced prostate cancer, not certain about all the numbers but 5/5 and 4/5 on the Gleason and PSA when first found 893. My PSA is now down to 0.64 I have prostat3 hormone injections and chemo is docetaxel for six turns, my forth is coming up. After the chemo like everyone I get really tired very weak and always seem to develop a cough, my temp can really jump around, I was in hospital after my third chemo as it soared to 38.3 and my white blood cell count was down to 0.3 but after three days in there all better now. At the end of my chemo in February I have radiology on my prostate to shrink it just want some feed back on this and what people think. Thanks Joe

AgeInfo.Phrase: is now down to 0 64 I have prostat3 hormone injections

Posts.Title: Prostate cancer new to forum

Posts.Content: Hi I am 64 fairly fit as I had a job were I was always on the go,I had a scan and the cancer as far as I know had gone into my shoulder possibly some were else and maybe the lymph nodes not certain were because of my high scores. I eat fish chicken most stuff without red bars on them, no take aways anymore and the only drink is pomegranate, orange, tomato juice and water. I have a discussion with the orolgy dept this week about how things are going I have a nice list of questions if any one can think of anything I need to ask just reply it to me.

AgeInfo.Phrase: <Z> <Z> Hi I am 64 fairly fit as I had

Posts.Title: Prostate cancer new to forum

Posts.Content: Hi thanks the reason for the radiography is to shrink the prostate, I have looked into this and it is a practice that is done when the prostate cannot be removed.
Posts.Title: Prostate cancer new to forum

Posts.Content: Thanks for that I will keep coming back see if anyone has some info for me.
Posts.Title: Prostate cancer new to forum

Posts.Content: Hi No I take no steroids now, when I was on the chemo I had to take them four days before and two after, plus six injections into the stomach one a day, I had various Meds for nausea diahorrea etc, the main thing that got me was the shortness of breath from the hormone injections ( Prostap 3 think it's called lupron ) that was a devil could put up with every thing else but that. Joe
Posts.Title: Starting Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Hi Rob I did six sessions of doxcetaxel and yes there is hair loss graduly, the first couple of days nothing seems to happen, then wham every bone in my body felt like it was on fire for eight hours, fatigue and tiredness, later loss of taste, scratchy blurred eyesight, everyone is different these are some of the side effects that hit me. Hopefully you will miss a few of these, the one thing you must do is your Tempreture very important as your red blood cells will be fairly low and infection can happen quickly, it did for me on my third session, neutrippenna, hospitalised for a few days. So above 38 or below 36 get to the hospital. Joe
Posts.Title: Starting Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Hi Rob I did six sessions of doxcetaxel and yes there is hair loss graduly, the first couple of days nothing seems to happen, then wham every bone in my body felt like it was on fire for eight hours, fatigue and tiredness, later loss of taste, scratchy blurred eyesight, everyone is different these are some of the side effects that hit me. Hopefully you will miss a few of these, the one thing you must do is your Tempreture very important as your red blood cells will be fairly low and infection can happen quickly, it did for me on my third session, neutrippenna, hospitalised for a few days. So above 38 or below 36 get to the hospital. Joe
Posts.Title: Starting Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Hi No I take no steroids now, when I was on the chemo I had to take them four days before and two after, plus six injections into the stomach one a day, I had various Meds for nausea diahorrea etc, the main thing that got me was the shortness of breath from the hormone injections ( Prostap 3 think it's called lupron ) that was a devil could put up with every thing else but that. Joe
Posts.Title: Starting Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Hi wolf I am at the same stage as you, on my forth chemo at the moment docetaxel, but prostat3 hormone, on a trial that's called Stampede. I ve had just one bad bout so far when I suffered from a very low white cell count neptrippena or something like that, I was the only person in my group to have this but came through it. Keep on the good fight, there are plenty of people here with ideas and messages that can help in many ways,so keep calling back. Best wishes Joeven
Posts.Title: New to Forums! 56 Year old with stage IV prostate cancer (bone mets)

Posts.Content: Hi I saw on specialist last week, I told him I had a few things happening, my shoulders still playing me up, my backs causing me some pain and restriction in movement, my shoulder cannot have another dose of radiotherapy, but I have radiotherapy next week on my prostate so nothing can be done for my back yet. I also mentioned about the hot flashes which in my case is a full body wash worse at bed time. He prescribed. Medroxprogesterone acetate 10mg two tablets a day and they seem to be working so any other sufferers out there give them a try.
Posts.Title: Hot flash medication

Posts.Content: Hi Those scores are not the greatest, with him being scanned and the bones detected that are infected, radiotherapy may well help with the pain, I would certainly ask about this, it's not a cure but will help lessen the pain. I know as I had it in my shoulder and I just had one fraction of radiotherapy on it. It's still gives me a bit of pain but nowhere near what I was suffering. Hope this helps. Joe
Posts.Title: Recent Stage IV Diagnosis

Posts.Content: Hi Those scores are not the greatest, with him being scanned and the bones detected that are infected, radiotherapy may well help with the pain, I would certainly ask about this, it's not a cure but will help lessen the pain. I know as I had it in my shoulder and I just had one fraction of radiotherapy on it. It's still gives me a bit of pain but nowhere near what I was suffering. Hope this helps. Joe
Posts.Title: Recent Stage IV Diagnosis

Posts.Content: Hi all I ve been on Prostap ( lupron ) hormone injections for nearly a year now, I've always been short of breath using this, also tired and fatigued, has anybody had the same symptoms and did they take anything to combat it ? Be interested in replies. Joe
Posts.Title: Lipton ( Prostap )

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I am due to start my radiotherapy in a week on the prostate, has anyone had this done and what was your outcome. Also has anyone had radiotherapy on their pelvis ? As I have metastistic pc in shoulder and pelvis, I had one session on my shoulder but that was it. Lastly if any of you with knowledge or experience if you have a very low PSA below 0.08 does the desease in your bones carry on spreading ?
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi There was two things going on with my shoulder, first they were not sure of the desease was there as I had frozen shoulder, so I had cortesone injections in it then radiotherapy, both eased it lots but still have problems, was wondering could the same be done to my pelvis?
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Jim Strangely enough, I suffer from gout, some years ago I had an operation on my big toe, it seemed that the cartilage connecting it had worn away and a pin had to be inserted connecting it back. I know it's extremely rare to get it that high but you never know the way my lucks running.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Thanks, I certainly hope so, I still have plenty of pains and aches going on, stomach, shoulder and back, just hoping they improve. It's all been very hard for my wife, who constantly worries about me, hardly lets me do some relatively easy tasks in case I hurt myself, but if I get through the radiotherapy ok I am sure she will be in a better frame of mind.
Posts.Title: PSA new low

Posts.Content: Hi I have a very low PSA of 0.04 I am a g9 stage t4 prostate cancer victim, had all the chemo etc, on three monthly injections my PSA was 893, was diagnosed in June last year. My question I still suffer with stomach aches and pains and back ache ( although had the back X rayed and told no cancer there ) does anyone know if cancer can still spread even with a low PSA. Thanks guys. Joe
Posts.Title: Can cancer spread with a very low psa

Posts.Content: Hi Thanks, I know my PSA is good, just worried about the secondary bone cancer, as when I try and excercise a bit, it leaves me short of breath, although this could be the hormone injections. Still thinking of trying Acupunture on my shoulder though.
Posts.Title: Metastistic secondary bone cancer

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by ChemoMan Hi You have what we in the lymphoma forum call "the noise". This is the little voice in your head that says "cancer" every time you feel something out of the ordinary. It gets loudest at around two years after treatment. Chances are you are suffering longterm side effects from the chemo. That stuff is really toxic and quite capable of producing those symptoms. As always if you are really concerned you should talk it over with your doctor. Chances are that something else could be at play and a doctor can investigate that for you. Congratulations on achieving NED...long may it last Hi I have a number of side effects still going on the latest being some type of arthritis in my fingers, whenever something new happens I am at the docs, for this I am seeing people who specialise in finding out if it is arthritis and how to proceed. My main thing is staying away from sugar sweets etc I have one lolly every so often that's as near as I get, i am partial to spicy food but try to limit that as I have acid reflux anther side effect. I am very easy going and I would be a liar if I said maybe twice a day I get depressed but only for a minute and that's the hormone doing that. Being on a Stampede trial I am monitored every three months, they always ask me about quality of life, which I give not great scores to as I have a number of things going on, hoping to get a chest X-ray see if any things happening and another back X-ray as Iam only 65 and thought I should be making in roads to this back pain. So keep you informed. Joe

AgeInfo.Phrase: X ray as Iam only 65 and thought I should be

Posts.Title: Can cancer spread with a very low psa

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I have my last chemo next week, then in Febuary I start 20 sessions of radiotherapy over 4 weeks on my prostate, my PSA has dropped from 893 to 0.11 which I presume is good, ( pity my Gleason score which is 9 does not go the same way ) anyway has anybody else had radiotherapy on their prostate and what was the out come plus any side effects. I have been on a trial ( still am ) called Stampede and the radiotherapy is the last part my chemo was docetaxel and hormone was Prosvac, if that helps at all.

AgeInfo.Phrase: then in Febuary I start 20 sessions of radiotherapy over 4

Posts.Title: Radiotherapy some help

Posts.Content: Hi Dking I have just finished six sessions of chemo and I am on 12 weekly cycles of hormone ( Prostap ) I have a Gleason of 9 and my PSA was 893. My PSA is now 0.08 so something must be working. The ride through chemotherapy can be a real eye opener, but it helps kill the pc, make sure you listen to all what is said if you go ahead, as some of the side effects and I there will be some may keep you on your toes. Sorry if I was a bit foreward with the description but you need to know, I have simuler problems except mine is in the shoulder maybe the hip/ pelvis as well. As Micheganman16 says excercise is good, if and when you can even a stroll just to keep active. Hope all goes well take care.
Posts.Title: chemo and hormone therapy

Posts.Content: Hi Thanks these seven months have been a trying time for both of us, if I could get a few bits sorted eg chest pains and defiantly this shoulder, I would be a happy person. Still suffer a bit with the grey matter ( brain ) as in having to remember things or just about to do something and have to put a little thought into what it was, but I am hoping some of these will subside once the chemo has worn down.
Posts.Title: PSA new low

Posts.Content: Hi Thanks guys, I always wondered about why it has never been tried, I know it can cure as well as kill but in smaller doses could it kill off the PSA rises, or even the tumours food for thought. Joe
Posts.Title: Electricity as a cure

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Been a while since I ve been on, my question to any one who knows, has electricity been used as a cure for PC in any form, if so do they know the results and what were the findings ? I had a X-ray on my back was giving me more pain than usual and was told I had it in my spine and pelvis, went for my blood check up a few days ago told them and they said it was in most of my bones from the early scan when diagnosed 20 months ago, at the time I was only told it was in my shoulder which I had RT on and my upper rib. To say I was taken back was an understatement, I go for an MRI tonight on my back see if there's any damage. My PSA is still very low at 0.07 a slight rise from 0.04 with all my organs still in good shape although liver very slightly higher but still within normal range. Thanks for looking if you have any info would be grateful Joe

AgeInfo.Phrase: is still very low at 0 07 a slight rise from

Posts.Title: Electricity as a cure

Posts.Content: I finished my last chemo at Christmas, I am on the Stampede trial, had my chat and bloods done a few days ago, a new low for my PSA it's now 0.08 from 893 when first diagnosed in July 2016, only hoping the radiotherapy I have next month helps a bit more.
Posts.Title: PSA new low

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Thanks for the support, It's not easy for my wife, as I am retired ( just hehe ) and she still has to work. My wife had time out looking after me while I had the chemo as everyone knows it can hit you like a brick and some times you need some one there to stop you doing things you thought were easy before, not now. My wife ( bless her, ) is back part time but constantly texts me checking how I am doing it's very very hard on her. We'll see my specialist about my radiotherapy this Friday so if anyone knows some questions to throw at him just let me know, thank you.
Posts.Title: PSA new low

Posts.Content: Hi st3v3 I ve been in hospital and the doctors a couple of times with my shortness of breath, it occurs on two occasions, one when I excercise to much ( as I have it in my shoulder ) I do arm excercise and later in the day or next day it can cause breathlessness, the other is when I take pain killers like co-codermol, or paracetamol, maybe six throughout the day causes the same as mentioned. Seeing my doctor see what he can do for me. Best to all.
Posts.Title: Metastistic secondary bone cancer

Posts.Content: Hi All I have put the odd post on here, after finishing my last chemo four weeks ago, I am on 12 weekly hormone jabs of Prostap. My PSA is down to 0.08. Here's my question. I have secondary bone desease in my shoulder, maybe in my pelvis or hip, will the desease carry on spreading with the PSA being so low or be held at bay for now ? The other thing is I have always since this started suffered from shortness of breath, I put it down to the hormone jab but if anyone has any other ideas please let me know. Thanks
Posts.Title: Metastistic secondary bone cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Bill Yep I am from Manchester UK, believe me I used to love a drink three or four strong lagers every night helped me sleep ( Iam a terrible insomniac) I know they say it's ok to have the odd drink in proportion, but why bother, if it keeps me here another year or three doing this then it's worth it. Having said that its my 65th May 3rd and I've had two cans in the fridge for ten months so that's my birthday treat .
Posts.Title: PSA During Hormone Treatment

Posts.Content: Hi I still have my prostate maybe because I am a Gleason 9. I had twenty sessions of radiotherapy and I am on Prostap 3 hormone every three months ( for life ) had chemo doxcetaxel 6 sessions. My initial PSA was 893 and I ate drank everything that was prostate friendly no sugar no alcohol no red meat. Anyway mine which was taken last week is down to 0.07 and I intend it to get lower, as with radiotherapy it can spike and I finished mine four weeks ago.
Posts.Title: PSA During Hormone Treatment

Posts.Content: Hi To all our fighters out there keep up the positive approach and carry on for the on coming year, a Merry Christmas to all. Regards Joeven
Posts.Title: Merry christmas

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I have advanced prostate cancer, for a fair amount of time I have suffered from muscle spasms they can be anywhere, arms legs stomach and are perpetual happening constantly, asked the nurse about it when I had my last chemo and she did not have an answer, so thought I would ask here. I am on a trial called STAMPEDE which is hormone Prosvac and chemo docetaxel, with 20 doses of radiotherapy over 4 weeks when the chemo has finished. If anyone has an answer ?
Posts.Title: Muscle spasms

Posts.Content: Hi Mine occur through the day and can be one after the other, researched a bit on it, might have to see the doc, but one help was take a couple of paracetamol, which I did and seems to have slowed it down a bit.
